meanings.definition: Characterized by squirming or wriggling movements.
meanings.sent1: The baby was the squirmiest during diaper changes.
meanings.sent2: The puppy was the squirmiest of all the siblings.
meanings.sent3: The squirmiest worm in the garden made the kids giggle.
meanings.sent4: The caterpillar was the squirmiest dancer at the bug ball.
meanings.sent5: The squirmiest fish in the tank always caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of squirm, meaning to twist and turn the body in a wriggling motion.
meanings.sent1: She squirmed squirmiest when tickled on her sides.
meanings.sent2: The snake squirmed squirmiest when trying to escape.
meanings.sent3: The spaghetti squirmed squirmiest on the plate, making it hard to eat.
meanings.sent4: The vines squirmed squirmiest around the tree, seeking support.
meanings.sent5: The earthworm squirmed squirmiest after the rain, enjoying the wet soil.
